content.description:
Climb the slab into a corner below a roof. Navigate the right side of the roof to a bulge (crux). Don't let your guard down until you've clipped the last bolt! Very fun climb that will make you think. 

At the left end of the Gallery. Hike up to a flat platform beneath a black slab.
bolts. runout after the last bolt on easy terrain

Nice long route with a wide variety of featured climbing. Cracks, face, slab, overhangs.

Left edge of the Gallery Wall.
Single rack to 3" piece. You could use a 4 but not necessary. Rapell anchor on top.

Climb the obvious corner of L-Shape wall. Two pitches which can be combined as one. First pitch is better than the second. The second pitch is mostly adventure climbing to gain the large terrace. This route can be slow to dry after a rain, especially in the fall. 


Where Joe's Garage meets the Gallery (L-Shape). The big corner
standard rack. Bolted anchors

Climb the short corner to the ledge. Walk to the very right of the ledge and climb up the crack system. When the crack ends, clip a bolt and continue to the belay ledge.

Start as for Waterwalk, at the base of a short corner leading to a ledge.
standard rack. 1 bolt

Start right of the wide crack just right of the access gully to Dawn Wall.  Make your way up via a variety of choices until you reach the thin crack splitting a short wall.  Climb the crack and continue above passing a sappy tree until you finally reach the first belay ledge of Light Fandango.  Adds a nice long start to Light Fandango.

Standar gear rack.

Climb vertical cracks and small corners about 5m left of the Sparky Start corner. Continue on lower angled rock angling right past some bolts, eventually ending on the big ledge.

First crack system to the left of the Sparky Start corner
standard rack, 2 bolts

Climb the black face past 3 bolts to easier climbing. Shares an anchor with A Never Ending Story.

left end of the Gallery. Start on a flat platform and climb the bolted black face.
bolts at the crux. PG gear above

P1: Climb the short buttress starting down and right from the obvious black face of Painted Black directly underneath the first bolt. You can stick clip the first bolt or make 5.6 moves up the face to get it clipped. Mantle the block then continue up through a corner system clipping two more bolts. From here you can either move slightly left following a line that will eventually lead to the Never Ending Story anchor or follow the shallow corner slightly right up a newer line that will take you to an independant bolted anchor. 

P2: From the spacious belay ledge move up through crack systems leftward toward a good sized spruce tree on the left side of a face. Continue up through this easy but fun crack system to a ledge and bolted belay at the top of the Gallery Wall slabs. 

This is an excellent two pitch route and makes for a very straight forward and pleasant way to access climbs in The Alley. 



3 bolts on pitch 1. Bolted anchors. Standard rack to 3" piece. A number 4 could be useful but not absolutely necessary.  Rap the route.

Start just to the left of the access gully to Dawn Wall.  Climb a small slab that leads to a splitter crack.  Climb the crack into a V-notch.  Continue up past 3 tree stumps, then pass a very sappy tree.  Continue up to the first belay ledge of Light Fandango

A number 3 and 4 Camelot is very beneficial, otherwise a standard rack is good.

This is a second pitch. From the ledge and anchor for A Never Ending Story, climb up past some ledges aiming for the nice face with a bolt and some horizontal cracks.

Climb either A Never Ending Story, Painted Black, or the first pitch of Pink Stripe on Grey Canvas to get to the ledge where this route starts.
Standard rack. 1 bolt

Climb up a short wall to a ledge then up into the dihedral past a bolt. Above the dihedral, climb a nice hand-sized crack and step right to the large belay ledge.

The dihedral. Left of a blunt arete with an obvious flake (The flake of Trundling by Moonlight)
standard rack. 1 bolt

Start up the same short corner as for Waterwalk. From the ledge 15ft up, step left into a crack system. A mantel move will help you get to the obvious flake on the arete. Continue up and left to join the hand-sized crack of Sparky Start Variation.

Starts up a short corner leading to a ledge.
standard rack. Bolted anchor

P1: Climb up the corner to the ledge. Continue up the vertical crack which turns to slabby cracks. Step right into another crack and follow this past some wide sections to the belay ledge.
P2: Seldom climbed because it's mostly adventure climbing and usually dirty. From the ledge, climb straight up past a blocky face to a ledge with a pine tree. Continue up staying somewhat left of the Boulevard corner.

Start up a short corner leading to a ledge.
standard rack. bolted anchors

The Gallery Wall forms the left side of what is also referred to as L-Shape. It's about 200' tall (though not all routes are full length) and mostly less than vertical, extending from the Dawn wall area and meeting up with Joe's Garage in the corner. The right side features several nice trad routes ending on a perfect ledge. A Never Ending Story is an excellent sport route which should not be missed by anyone climbing at the grade.
Some routes on the right side are often combined with a second and third pitch on Joe's Garage.
